title.narrative: Climate change and regional agricultural commodity flows

description.narrative: China is committed to accelerating the growth prospects of its rural areas and to improving the welfare of its 750 million rural people under the Rural Development: Building a New Socialist Countryside program. One of this program's main aims is to ensure food security consistent with better environmental outcomes - taking into account the likely longer-term constraints on Chinese agriculture, including those arising from climate change. The aim of this project is to determine how regional agricultural commodity production and trade flows are likely to change over the remainder of this century as a result of climate change, urbanisation and income growth, with a particular focus on inflows and outflows in developing regions. The project team will develop a model to aid the design of practical public policies directed at poverty alleviation in rural China. From the modelling, researchers will provide the broad macroeconomic and long-term trade context that will determine the likely economic environment in which practical pro-rural development policies must be introduced.
